meanings.definition: To object again or in response to something.
meanings.sent1: She decided to reobject to the new rule during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: He tends to reobject whenever his ideas are not considered.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to reobject to the idea of taking a bath.
meanings.sent4: The students continued to reobject, like a chorus of dissent.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise made it hard for her to reobject effectively.

meanings.definition: To present or raise an objection.
meanings.sent1: They will reobject to the proposal at the next meeting.
meanings.sent2: It is important to reobject respectfully in a debate.
meanings.sent3: The toddler decided to reobject to eating vegetables.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes seemed to reobject, filled with doubt and concern.
meanings.sent5: The lawyer had to reobject quickly to the misleading statement.

meanings.definition: To oppose or disagree with something.
meanings.sent1: The group plans to reobject to the construction of the new building.
meanings.sent2: She tends to reobject to any changes in the schedule.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to reobject to wearing the costume for Halloween.
meanings.sent4: His actions clearly reobjected to the unfair treatment.
meanings.sent5: The crowd started to reobject loudly, demanding justice.
